title: Using the Power Property of Logarithms.
text: Use the Power Property of Logarithms: $$\log_{a}\left(M^p\right)$$ $$=$$ $$p*\log_{a}\left(M\right)$$.
speech: Use the Power Property of Logarithms:  the log base a of, parentheses   m to the p-th,    is equal to,  , p times the log base a of   m .
pacedSpeech: Use the Power Property of Logarithms:   the log base a of,    m to the p-th,
, p times the log base a of   m

title: Applying the rule to this question.
speech: In this case,  the log base 10 of, parentheses x to the one hundredth,    is equal to,  , 100 times the log base 10 of x .
pacedSpeech: In this case,   the log base 10 of,  x to the one hundredth,
, 100 times the log base 10 of x
